jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities:

The Office of Safety and Mission Success (OSMS) establishes and leads Environmental, Health & Safety, and Mission Assurance programs for projects and tasks that appropriately lead risks and improve the probability of mission safety and success. Our values are:

“Teamwork, Independence, Courage, Balance, Credibility, Respect, Stewardship”

Provide administrative assistance to one or more executives, which involves composing business communications, carrying out high level projects and/or initiatives; troubleshooting and resolving sophisticated problems; crafting and developing presentation materials from original content, etc. Ensure compliance with Institute policies and procedures and Government regulations. Work requires independent action, multifaceted communication, planning, and originality. Conduct research, prepare, and write critical reports, materials, procedures, and statistics. May act as liaison to external organizations, including representation and participation in various committees.

The Executive Staff Coordinator will be a member of the Office of Safety and Mission Success staff and report to the 5X Business Manager. You will be working independently under limited supervision and provide confidential business support to the OSMS Director For, Deputy Director For, and immediate Directorate staff requiring significant discretion, judgment, tact, and subtlety.  In addition, this role also supports the 5X Business Manager within OSMS.

Tasks include but not be limited to:

  • Arrange sophisticated programmatic and conference travel, both domestic and foreign, for executive management.

  • Proactively handle the Director For and Deputy Director For schedules; identify and mitigate potential issues; ensure Director For and Deputy Director For remain on schedule; proactively connect with partners for schedule changes. 

  • Manage the OSMS calendar and arrange meetings, reviews, and conferences.

  • On behalf of executive management, interact regularly and manage relationships with the Director’s Office, internal and external organizations, NASA Headquarters, and NASA centers.

  • Initiate and compose correspondence on behalf of executive management.

  • Evaluate and prioritize all material received and ensure accurate disposition.

  • Research, initiate, and build presentation material, reports, and correspondence for executive leadership.

  • Complete assignments that are discreet in nature and require considerable judgment and discretion.

  • Interprets applicable internal Laboratory and NASA processes, policies, requirements and procedures.

  • Support in coordinating and leading of all guests to OSMS; submitting visit requests, coordinating the agenda, soliciting volunteer speakers and escorts as needed.

  • Assist OSMS in owning the annual NASA Honor awards, Centralized awards, and Decentralized awards call.

  • Coordinate and plan OSMS events from inception through execution (Explore JPL, Retreats, Holiday parties)

  • Schedule speakers and build agenda for OSMS leadership meetings.

  • Maintain the data infrastructure for the Directorate (Alfresco, website, wiki). Maintain documentation for Functional Authorities, Laser Safety Officer Authority, and Dissenting Opinions.

  • Guide and mentor Directorate Staff Assistants.

  • Assist with P-card purchases, iProcurement and purchase requisitions.

  • May participate in other projects or tasks on an as needed basis.

Qualifications:

  • Typically requires an Associate’s degree and a minimum of 3 years of related experience; Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, or related field with a minimum of 1 year of related experience.

  • Demonstrated expertise in office administration supporting high level executives.

  • Solid experience in planning, coordinating, and scheduling calendars and tasks for upper-level management.

  • Sophisticated understanding of executive office processes, procedures, and applied knowledge and skills in this area.

  • Ability to prioritize diverse work assignments and provide leadership to other administrative personnel.

  • Demonstrated experience researching and drafting original materials and PowerPoint charts.

  • Ability to work under pressure on multiple sophisticated tasks and work independently to meet commitments and deliver high quality products.

  • Ability to get along with all levels of personnel; experience working with senior and executive management.

  • Excellent digital literacy with expertise in MS Office

  • Extensive experience in handling discreet and confidential materials and providing confidential business support to senior management.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication; excellent interpersonal skills.

  • Ability to anticipate future requests and initiate actions to support those needs.

  • Exercises judgment in applying applicable policies, procedures, and practices to new situations to resolve appropriate action.

Preferred Skills:

  • Solid understanding of JPL EBIS applications, Wiki, and Alfresco

  • Extensive knowledge of applicable Laboratory policies and procedures, NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations.

  • Dynamic experience displaying growth in responsibility as an executive assistant to senior management.

  • Familiarity with JPL acronyms and terminology.

  • Knowledge of appropriate protocols in looking after high-profile government and foreign officials.

  • May require Foreign National Escort training.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks

The hiring range displayed below is specifically for those who will work in or reside in the location listed. In extending an offer, Jet Propulsion Laboratory considers factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s job related skills, experience, knowledge, and relevant education/training. Hiring range for this job may be adjusted based on primary work location outside of Pasadena, California. This adjusted range will be provided to candidates by the Recruiter when applicable.
